description: From water +‎ works (“machine, mechanism; factory or factories”).

entries.meaning: The water supply system of a district, town, city, or other place, including reservoirs, pipes, and pumps.
(treated as singular) Any single facility, such as a filtration plant or pumping station, within such a system.
examples: She is employed by a waterworks at the outskirts of the city.

entries.meaning: (informal) Often in the form turn on the waterworks: crying or tears, especially in a way that is considered manipulative or over-emotional.
examples: She turned on the waterworks when we told her the old man was dead, but she was asking questions about the will soon enough.

entries.meaning: (historical, treated as singular) A hydraulic apparatus by which a supply of water is furnished for ornamental purposes; also, an ornamental fountain or waterfall.
(construction, archaic) Engineering works relating to the conveyance and flow of fluids (principally water), such as the collection and distribution of water, drainage, irrigation, etc.
